00050 /// String describing quant method
00051 #define QUANTBIRDSEEDDEV "birdseed-dev"
00052 
00053 class QuantBirdseedDev : public QuantBirdseed {
00054 
00055   public:
00056 
00057     /** 
00058      * What version of the BRLMM algorithm are we implementing?
00059      * @return version string.
00060      */
00061     std::string getVersion() {
00062         return "2.5";
00063     }
00064 
00065     /** Constructor, currently creates prior estimates from pre-calculated data from R. */
00066     QuantBirdseedDev(double confidenceThreshold, double correctionFactor): QuantBirdseed(confidenceThreshold, correctionFactor)
00067     {
00068         setupSelfDoc(*this);
00069 
00070         setOptValue("correction-factor", ToStr(m_CorrectionFactor));
00071         setOptValue("conf-threshold", ToStr(m_ConfidenceThreshold));
00072 
00073     }
00074 
00075     ~QuantBirdseedDev()
00076     {
00077     }
00078     
00079 
00080     /** Fill in our self documentation from current state. */
00081     static void setupSelfDoc(SelfDoc &doc) {
00082         doc.setDocName(QUANTBIRDSEEDDEV);
00083         doc.setDocDescription("Do genotyping calls using the Birdseed Developmental algorithm.");
00084         doc.setDocOptions(getDefaultDocOptions());
00085     }
00086   
00087     /** 
00088      * @brief Do the heavy lifting of estimation.
00089      */
00090     void computeEstimate();
00091 
00092 
00093     /** 
00094      * @brief What is the name of the quantification method?
00095      * @return name of adjuster.
00096      */  
00097     std::string getType() {
00098         return std::string(QUANTBIRDSEEDDEV);
00099     }
00100 
00101 
00102     /** 
00103      * @brief Default Getter method for parameters and their documentation.
00104      * @return map of parameters and their descriptions.
00105      */
00106     static std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> getDefaultDocOptions();
00107 
00108     /** 
00109      * @brief Supply a little how/what/why about the algorithms this
00110      * class performs and what parameters it takes.
00111      * @return SelfDoc
00112      */
00113     static SelfDoc explainSelf();
00114 
00115     /** 
00116      * @brief This static function should be overridden by child classes
00117      * to return an object of the correct type initialized correctly
00118      * with the parameters in the string, string map. All objects
00119      * created this way should be deleted when finished using.
00120      * 
00121      * @param param - Map of key/value pairs to initialize the object.
00122      * 
00123      * @return Pointer toCreate object, this should be sub casted as necessary.
00124      */
00125     static SelfCreate *newObject(std::map<std::string,std::string> &param);
00126   
00127     /** 
00128      * How many genotyping calls do we have? Also indicates how many
00129      * samples there are.
00130      *
00131      * @return Number of genotyping calls made.
00132      */
00133     inline size_t getNumCalls() { return m_Calls.size(); }
00134 
00135     /** 
00136      * Get our confidence value for a particular call in a particular sample.
00137      * @param index - sample of interest.
00138      * @return - Confidence in the predicted call.
00139      */
00140     double getConfidence(unsigned int index) { 
00141         if(index >= m_Confidences.size()) {
00142             Err::errAbort("Asking for call at index " + ToStr(index) + " when Probeset " + 
00143                           m_ProbesetName + " has only " + ToStr(m_Confidences.size()) + " calls.");
00144         }
00145         return m_Confidences[index];
00146     }
00147 
00148     /** 
00149      * Get our confidence value for a particular call in a particular sample.
00150      * @param genoType -  Genotype of interest.
00151      * @param index - sample of interest.
00152      * @return - Confidence in the predicted call.
00153      */
00154     double getConfGenotype(affx::GType genoType, unsigned int index) {
00155         assert(index < m_Distances.size());
00156         if(genoType == affx::NN) 
00157             return FLT_MAX;
00158         return m_Distances[index][genoType];
00159     }
00160 
00161     /** 
00162      * Get the summary value after transformation for the A and B alleles respectively.
00163      * 
00164      * @param index - Which chip to get values for.
00165      * @param aValue - Filled in with transformed a value.
00166      * @param bValue - Filled in with transformed b value.
00167      */
00168     void getAlleleValues(unsigned int index, double &aValue, double &bValue) {
00169         assert(index < m_AValues.size());
00170         assert(m_AValues.size() == m_BValues.size());
00171         aValue = m_AValues[index];
00172         bValue = m_BValues[index];
00173     }
00174 
00175     /** 
00176     * Get the summary value names for the A and B alleles respectively.
00177     * 
00178     * @param aName - Filled in with a value name.
00179     * @param bName - Filled in with b value name.
00180     */
00181     void getAlleleValueNames(std::string &aName, std::string &bName)
00182     {
00183         aName = "Signal A";
00184         bName = "Signal B";
00185     }
00186 
00187     /** 
00188      * Get the name of the probeset that these calls are being made for. 
00189      * @return name of probeset.
00190      */
00191     const std::string &getProbeSetName() { return m_ProbesetName; }
00192 
00193     /** 
00194      * Add an expression reporter to output the summary values for each
00195      * allele, residuals, etc.
00196      * 
00197      * @param reporter - the object that will output all summary values.
00198      */
00199     void addExprReporter(QuantMethodReport *reporter) {
00200         m_Reporters.push_back(reporter);
00201     }
00202   
00203     /* Set the quantification method to use for summarizing individual alleles */
00204     void setQuantExprMethod(QuantExprMethod *qMethod) {
00205         m_QuantMethod = qMethod;
00206     }
00207     /* Get the quantification method to use for summarizing individual alleles */
00208     QuantExprMethod *getQuantExprMethod() {
00209         return m_QuantMethod;
00210     }
00211 
00212     double getConfidenceThreshold(){ return(m_ConfidenceThreshold);};
00213         void setConfidenceThreshold(double v){m_ConfidenceThreshold=v;};
00214 
00215   // We should test for the format of the file here.
00216   void setPriorFile(const std::string& priorsPath, const string &chipType, 
00217                     std::set<const char *, Util::ltstr> *probeSetsToLoad, 
00218                     const std::map<std::string, std::pair< int, int > > &specialSnps);
00219 
00220   void setVerbosity(int v)
00221   {
00222     verbosity = v;
00223   }

00225 //   void setClusterOutFile(const std::string& clusterOutPath)

00229 //   }
00230     
00231   double getMinThresh() { return -DBL_MAX;}
00232   double getMaxThresh() { return m_ConfidenceThreshold;}
00233 
00234   virtual bool finish() {
00235       bool result = true;
00236       if (m_ClusterOstrm.get() != NULL) {
00237           Fs::carefulClose(*m_ClusterOstrm);
00238       }
00239       for(size_t i=0; i<m_Reporters.size(); i++)
00240           result = result && m_Reporters[i]->finish(*this);
00241       return result;
00242   }
00243 
00244 };
